Type A viruses are more likely to cause pandemics because they can infect both animals and humans, while type B viruses only infect humans. Type A viruses are also divided into subtypes based on two proteins on the surface of the virus. The subtypes can change due to genetic mutations, leading to new strains of influenza viruses.

A test called a rapid influenza diagnostic test (RIDT) can be used to detect influenza viruses in respiratory secretions. RIDTs give results within 15-30 minutes. However, RIDTs are not as accurate as other laboratory tests like RT-PCR, which can detect influenza viruses more accurately.
